oai_dc:dc.dc:title: PREDICTION OF THE DIMENSIONS OF A RIP CURRENT SYSTEM ON A COAST WITH BARS
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Zyserman, Julio
Fredsoe, Jorgen
Deigaard, Rolf
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: rip current
bar
bar dimensions
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: A method to determine the dimensions of rip current systems (distance between rip currents, and width, and depth of the rip channels) is presented for the case of a coast with longshore bars. The method is based on an overall sediment balance in the nearshore region. The balance is determined by application of a model for the wave-induced flow combined with a sediment transport model. The influence of the wave height, the wave period, and the direction of wave propagation, as well as of the sediment size is analyzed.
oai_dc:dc.dc:source: Coastal Engineering Proceedings; No. 22 (1990): Proceedings of 22nd Conference on Coastal Engineering, Delft, The Netherlands, 1990.
